meanings.sent1: The honcho of the group made all the decisions.
meanings.sent2: The team honcho organized the project efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The picnic honcho made sure everyone had enough food.
meanings.sent4: She was the honcho of the dance floor, leading the group with style.
meanings.sent5: The classroom honcho was always ready to help others.

meanings.definition: To be in charge or lead.
meanings.sent1: He likes to honcho the team during group projects.
meanings.sent2: She will honcho the meeting tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: I will honcho the game night this weekend.
meanings.sent4: The captain honchoed the team to victory.
meanings.sent5: They honchoed the event with great success.
